sentence.text: Little Paul spends a short time at Mrs Pipchin 's ( on the recommendation of Miss Tox , a former child-boarder ) , where he is not quelled as the others are , but thoroughly discomfits her with his sharp questions and grave stare .
And then he discomfited her utterly by keeping that silence until he had turned into the Hamiltons ' driveway , switched off the engine , and opened the boot to retrieve her luggage .

While Danzigers remained unimpressed by Polish historical claims , Germany , too , longed to deny sovereignty , but found it more convenient in practice to encourage notions of the Free City 's independence , since this discomfited the Poles without direct confrontation .
Whatever he was saying clearly discomfited the librarian .

He confesses this is why he 's started leaping out in uncharacteristic new directions which discomfit the regulars , playing with bright colours and polka dots when the world expects sludge and subtle stripes ad nauseam .
Her remark that she could always have stayed home and made cookies has discomfited Republicans , not least Barbara Bush .
She looked away again , for her gaze seemed to discomfit Wolff , and said : ` I imagine there was never a more interesting time to be a banker than the present . "
It was plain that the two great detectives were discomfited by each other 's presence .
The Bolger government was further discomfited by renewed tension with France over the Rainbow Warrior affair .
They rocked in their seats to see how easily adults can be discomfited .
When Lotty and Rose finally arrived , they were discomfited to find Mrs Fisher , a formidable widow , and Lady Dester , a bored society beauty trying to escape male attention , already in residence .
This only discomfited the coroner further , he stared down at the floor and shuffled his feet like some clumsy schoolboy .

Normally , Pooley was concerned to hide his upper-class origins from the general public as well as from his police confr√®res , but occasionally Eton came in useful when he wanted to discomfit a member of the public who was treating him like PC Plod .
He was not noticeably discomfited by her tone .
Ronni snatched her gaze away , discomfited by the dark-eyed scrutiny .
